segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we have a special lesson for all of you who are looking for a new apartment or house.
segments.cn: 今天我们为所有正在寻找新公寓或房子的人准备了一节特别课程。

segments.en: Or even if you're not looking for an apartment, this lesson will be useful because it can help you describe what your current apartment or house looks like.
segments.cn: 即使你不在找公寓，这节课也会很有用，因为它可以帮助你描述你目前的公寓或房子的样子。

segments.en: That's right.
So we're going to be describing an apartment, another vocabulary related to apartment hunting.
segments.cn: 所以我们将描述一个公寓，以及与找公寓相关的其他词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at some of the first words that we have in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 我们先来看看词汇预览中的一些单词。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview We're going to hear these two words in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 词汇预览 我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: The first one is landlord.
Landlord.
Landlord.
Alright, so who is a landlord or what is a landlord?
segments.cn: 好的，房东是谁，或者说房东是什么？

segments.en: Well, it's pretty simple.
A landlord is the person who owns the house.
segments.cn: 房东是拥有房子的那个人。

segments.en: Okay.
Or apartment.
So the owner of the house.
Right.
And a landlord rents out the apartment to the tenants.
Okay, very good.
Tenants.
Tenants.
So the tenants are the people that are renting the apartment or house.
segments.cn: 租户是租住公寓或房子的人。

segments.en: Two important words that we'll find in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 对话中会出现的两个重要词。

segments.en: Tenants and landlord.
So why don't we take a listen to the dialogue now and we'll hear as a couple is checking out a new apartment.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来听听对话，看看一对夫妇在查看新公寓。

segments.en: Hi, we are the Christiansons.
We're here to see the apartment.
Oh, hi.
Short.
Come on in.
segments.cn: 如你所见，这个地方刚刚翻新过。

segments.en: Well, as you can see, the place has just been renovated.
segments.cn: 之前的租户留下了很大的麻烦，所以房东做了所有的工作。

segments.en: The previous tenants left a huge mess here, so the landlord has done everything.
It looks great.
It's so bright and airy.
What great light.
segments.cn: 我真的很喜欢这些硬木地板。

segments.en: What's the square footage of this place?
segments.cn: 这个地方的面积是多少？

segments.en: Well, it's about 120 square meters or 1300 square feet, more or less.
segments.cn: 嗯，大约120平方米或1300平方英尺，差不多。

segments.en: Oh, the landlord has also installed new kitchen appliances.
segments.cn: 哦，房东还安装了新的厨房电器。

segments.en: There's a new dishwasher and a professional-grade gas range.
segments.cn: 有新的洗碗机和专业级燃气灶。

segments.en: Really, at this price, this place is an amazing deal.
segments.cn: 真的，以这个价格，这个地方真是个惊人交易。

segments.en: I love it.
But wait, what are the payment terms?
segments.cn: 但是等等，付款条款是什么？

segments.en: First and last month rent as deposit and rent is due on the first of every month.
segments.cn: 首月和最后一个月的租金作为押金，租金在每月的第一天到期。

segments.en: Considering the amount of money invested into the apartment, it's a very good deal.
segments.cn: 考虑到投入公寓的资金，这真是个好交易。

segments.en: Yes, it is.
Too good to be true.
The living room and dining room are quite spacious, as you can see.
segments.cn: 客厅和餐厅相当宽敞，如你所见。

segments.en: And down this hall, here's the master bedroom.
segments.cn: 沿着这条走廊，这里是主卧室。

segments.en: It has a huge walk-in closet and an en-suite bathroom.
segments.cn: 它有一个巨大的步入式衣橱和一个套间浴室。

segments.en: We can't go in there yet, as the cleanup crew hasn't finished yet.
segments.cn: 我们还不能进去，因为清理队还没有完成。

segments.en: What do you mean?
What's in here?
Alright,
so apparently the apartment was too good to be true.
segments.cn: 显然这个公寓太好了，简直不真实。

segments.en: Yeah, I don't think that's exactly what they were expecting to find in the bathroom.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这不是他们在浴室里期待找到的。

segments.en: Exactly.
Well, we did find a lot of great words and phrases, so why don't we take a look at that now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们确实找到了很多很棒的单词和短语，所以我们现在来看看语言收获。

segments.en: We're just going to look at a bunch of vocabulary items related to apartments and house hunting.
segments.cn: 我们将查看与公寓和找房相关的一些词汇。

segments.en: So we've got a lot to cover here, so let's get started with the first one.
segments.cn: 我们有很多内容要覆盖，所以让我们开始第一个。

segments.en: Renovated.
Renovated.
Renovated.
Alright, so the apartment was newly renovated.
segments.cn: 好的，所以公寓是新翻新的。

segments.en: Okay, so the verb to renovate.
Great word, and I think some examples will help us understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 很好的词，我认为一些例子会帮助我们理解其含义。

segments.en: Example one.
I had to renovate my kitchen because I accidentally burned everything while cooking.
segments.cn: 我不得不翻新我的厨房，因为我在烹饪时不小心把一切都烧焦了。

segments.en: Example two.
The city recently renovated the ceiling of the local church.
segments.cn: 市政府最近翻新了当地教堂的天花板。

segments.en: Example three.
John is planning on renovating his nightclub so as to make it more modern.
segments.cn: 约翰计划翻新他的夜总会，以使其更现代。

segments.en: Okay, so basically to renovate means to make new again.
segments.cn: 好的，所以基本上翻新的意思是让它重新焕然一新。

segments.en: Right, when you renovate a house or an apartment, you take everything down and build it back up again.
segments.cn: 对，当你翻新一栋房子或公寓时，你会拆掉一切，然后重新建造。

segments.en: Okay, so it's usually only used for buildings, for apartments, for houses.
segments.cn: 好的，所以通常只用于建筑、公寓、房子。

segments.en: Or offices.
You don't say you renovate your computer.
segments.cn: 你不会说你翻新你的电脑。

segments.en: And also, when you just do something really simple, like change the paint color, that's not a renovation.
segments.cn: 而且，当你只是做一些非常简单的事情，比如改变油漆颜色，那不是翻新。

segments.en: That's redecoration.
When you renovate, you have to use a hammer and saw and lots of tools.
segments.cn: 当你翻新时，你必须使用锤子、锯子和很多工具。

segments.en: Okay, so the apartment was newly renovated and it was bright and airy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以公寓是新翻新的，明亮而通风。

segments.en: Airy?
Airy.
Alright, so airy, well I guess we understand the word air, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以通风，我想我们理解空气这个词，对吧？

segments.en: So if an apartment or something is airy.
segments.cn: 所以如果一个公寓或某物是通风的。

segments.en: It has lots of space.
Lots of place to move around.
Okay, so it's wide.
It's open.
It's open, okay.
An open apartment.
Very good.
Now for our next word.
An important question.
She asked for the square footage.
Square footage.
The square footage of the apartment.
Okay, so we know square foot, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我们知道平方英尺，对吧？

segments.en: So feet like a measure of space.
segments.cn: 所以英尺是空间的度量。

segments.en: The square footage is just basically the area, how big.
segments.cn: 平方英尺基本上就是面积，大小。

segments.en: Okay.
So why don't we listen to some examples of how we can use these two words, square footage, in a sentence.
segments.cn: 那么我们来听一些例子，看看如何在句子中使用这两个词，平方英尺。

segments.en: Example 1.
As a civil engineer, I have to calculate the square footage of the construction site.
segments.cn: 作为一名土木工程师，我必须计算施工现场的平方英尺。

segments.en: Example 2.
Robert is worried that the square footage of this land is not big enough.
segments.cn: 罗伯特担心这块土地的平方英尺不够大。

segments.en: Example 3.
If you multiply the width of the room by the length, you will have the square footage of the room.
segments.cn: 如果你将房间的宽度乘以长度，你就会得到房间的平方英尺。

segments.en: Those are some great examples and I find this, the ending of this word, ij, footage, it's interesting, isn't it?
segments.cn: 这些都是很好的例子，我发现这个词的结尾，ij，footage，很有趣，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you can only use it with the imperial system.
segments.cn: 是的，我想你只能在英制系统中使用它。

segments.en: So you can also say tonnage.
Right.
So how big, how heavy.
Or mileage.
Mileage.
Right, but you can't say, for example in meters, you wouldn't say meterage.
segments.cn: 对，但你不能说，比如在米中，你不会说米数。

segments.en: No, you can't say that.
Right?
So it's not for the metric system, it's only for some units of measurement in the imperial system.
segments.cn: 所以这不是公制系统，只适用于英制系统中的某些测量单位。

segments.en: Exactly.
Alright, so after we've measured the square footage of the apartment, we saw that they had new appliances.
segments.cn: 好吧，在我们测量了公寓的平方英尺后，我们看到他们有新的电器。

segments.en: Appliances.
Appliances.
Appliance.
So kitchen appliances, what are those?
Machines that do stuff in the kitchen.
segments.cn: 在厨房里做事情的机器。

segments.en: Alright, so a blender, a stove, a microwave.
segments.cn: 好吧，比如搅拌机、炉子、微波炉。

segments.en: Yep.
Or I can say electric appliances.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说电动电器。

segments.en: So like your TV, an iron, a vacuum cleaner.
segments.cn: 比如你的电视、熨斗、吸尘器。

segments.en: Okay, so appliance can be any type of machine that's used.
segments.cn: 好的，所以电器可以是任何类型的机器。

segments.en: In a house.
In a house.
Yep.
And well, one of these appliances was a professional grade gas range.
segments.cn: 而且，其中一个电器是专业级燃气灶。

segments.en: Okay, this is a great phrase and I want to break it down.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个很好的短语，我想分解一下。

segments.en: So a gas range.
Now this is basically a stove.
Okay.
That uses gas instead of electricity.
So I can have an electric range.
segments.cn: 所以我可以有一个电炉。

segments.en: Exactly.
Now professional grade, this is something that's really high quality.
segments.cn: 现在专业级，这意味着质量非常高。

segments.en: So if it's high quality, why do we say it's professional grade?
segments.cn: 如果它质量高，为什么我们说它是专业级？

segments.en: Because it's so good that professionals use it.
segments.cn: 因为它好到专业人士使用它。

segments.en: Okay, so can I only have professional grade kitchen appliances?
segments.cn: 好的，那么我只能拥有专业级厨房电器吗？

segments.en: No, of course not.
You can have a professional grade anything like a professional grade carpet, for example.
segments.cn: 你可以有任何专业级的东西，比如专业级地毯。

segments.en: Okay, or a professional grade pickup truck.
segments.cn: 好的，或者专业级皮卡车。

segments.en: Or you can even change this a little bit and say industrial grade.
segments.cn: 或者你甚至可以稍微改变一下，称之为工业级。

segments.en: So after we've seen all the appliances, they describe the house as spacious.
segments.cn: 所以在我们看到所有电器后，他们形容这所房子很宽敞。

segments.en: Spacious.
The house is very spacious.
Pretty easy.
We know the word space here, right?
segments.cn: 我们知道这里的空间这个词，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
So obviously this means lots of space.
segments.cn: 所以显然这意味着很多空间。

segments.en: It has lots of space.
So I guess maybe spacious and airy are a little bit similar, right?
segments.cn: 所以我想也许宽敞和通风有点相似，对吧？

segments.en: Okay.
And of course, once we were in the master bedroom, we saw that they had a walk-in closet.
segments.cn: 当然，当我们在主卧室时，我们看到他们有一个步入式衣橱。

segments.en: A walk-in closet.
Walk-in closet.
A walk-in closet.
Right, so this is very easy.
I guess walk-in.
You can walk into it.
Right, and so it's a huge closet, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以这是一个巨大的衣橱，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
Now just a note on the spelling here, walk-in are hyphenated.
segments.cn: 现在关于拼写的一个说明，步入式是连字符的。

segments.en: Okay, walk-in closet.
Very good.
And apart from this beautiful closet, we had an en-suite bathroom.
segments.cn: 除了这个漂亮的衣橱，我们还有一个套间浴室。

segments.en: En -suite bathroom.
En-suite bathroom.
Another note on the spelling here, it's E-N hyphen S-U-I-T-E.
segments.cn: 关于拼写的另一个说明，它是 E-N 连字符 S-U-I-T-E。

segments.en: So even though it's E-N, we pronounce it like an O-N.
segments.cn: 所以即使是 E-N，我们发音像 O-N。

segments.en: Yep.
En-suite.
So an en-suite bathroom is a bathroom inside the room.
segments.cn: 所以套间浴室是房间内的浴室。

segments.en: Okay, inside the master bedroom.
Very good.
En-suite bathroom.
So a lot of great words describing the apartment and also other aspects of real estate.
segments.cn: 所以有很多很好的词来描述公寓以及房地产的其他方面。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to these one more time in context and we'll see how they fit together to describe an apartment.
segments.cn: 那么我们再听一遍这些词在上下文中，看看它们如何结合在一起描述一间公寓。

segments.en: Hi, we are the Christiansons.
segments.cn: 嗨，我们是克里斯蒂安森一家。

segments.en: We're here to see the apartment.
Oh, hi.
Sure, come on in.
Well, as you can see, the place has just been renovated.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所看到的，这个地方刚刚翻新过。

segments.en: The previous tenants left a huge mess here, so the landlord has done everything.
segments.cn: 之前的租户在这里留下了很大的麻烦，所以房东做了所有的事情。

segments.en: It looks great.
It's so bright and airy.
What great light.
I really love these hardwood floors.
segments.cn: 我真的很喜欢这些硬木地板。

segments.en: What's the square footage of this place?
segments.cn: 这个地方的平方英尺是多少？

segments.en: Well, it's about 120 square meters or 1300 square feet, more or less.
segments.cn: 嗯，大约 120 平方米或 1300 平方英尺，差不多。

segments.en: Oh, the landlord has also installed new kitchen appliances.
segments.cn: 哦，房东还安装了新的厨房电器。

segments.en: There's a new dishwasher and a professional grade gas range.
segments.cn: 有新的洗碗机和专业级燃气灶。

segments.en: Really, at this price, this place is an amazing deal.
segments.cn: 真的，以这个价格，这个地方真是个惊人交易。

segments.en: I love it.
But wait, what are the payment terms?
segments.cn: 但等等，付款条款是什么？

segments.en: First and last month rent as deposit and rent is due on the first of every month.
segments.cn: 首月和末月租金作为押金，租金在每月的第一天到期。

segments.en: Considering the amount of money invested into the apartment, it's a very good deal.
segments.cn: 考虑到在公寓上投资的金额，这真是个好交易。

segments.en: Yes, it is.
Too good to be true.
The living room and dining room are quite spacious, as you can see.
segments.cn: 客厅和餐厅相当宽敞，你可以看到。

segments.en: And down this hall, here's the master bedroom.
segments.cn: 沿着这条走廊，这里是主卧室。

segments.en: It has a huge walk-in closet and an en-suite bathroom.
segments.cn: 它有一个巨大的步入式衣橱和一个套间浴室。

segments.en: We can't go in there yet as the police... I mean, the cleanup crew hasn't finished yet.
segments.cn: 我们还不能进去，因为警察……我的意思是，清理小组还没有完成。

segments.en: What do you mean?
What's in here?
Alright,
so this is always kind of difficult to look for a new apartment and to go and see them.
segments.cn: 找新公寓和去看公寓总是有点困难。

segments.en: But it's interesting, here they were renting and they had a real estate agent.
segments.cn: 但有趣的是，他们在这里租房，并且有一个房地产经纪人。

segments.en: Yeah, and actually this is very uncommon in America, isn't it?
segments.cn: 是的，实际上在美国这很不常见，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you don't really use a real estate agent unless you're going to buy a house or apartment.
segments.cn: 是的，我想除非你要买房子或公寓，否则你不会真的使用房地产经纪人。

segments.en: So when you're renting, you just go and look by yourself.
segments.cn: 所以当你租房时，你只需自己去看。

segments.en: Right, you can find ads in the newspaper or on the Internet and deal directly with the landlord.
segments.cn: 对，你可以在报纸或互联网上找到广告，直接与房东联系。

segments.en: Right.
So after you've done your house hunting and found your apartment, you've got to set up the payment conditions.
segments.cn: 所以在你找完房子并找到公寓后，你必须设定付款条件。

segments.en: Right, like we saw in the dialogue, the payment terms were first and last month's rent as deposit.
segments.cn: 对，就像我们在对话中看到的，付款条款是首月和末月租金作为押金。

segments.en: So that's basically they'll keep that just in case you damage something in the apartment.
segments.cn: 所以基本上他们会保留这笔钱，以防你在公寓里损坏了什么。

segments.en: Or have a monster living in your bathroom.
segments.cn: 或者在你的浴室里有个怪物。

segments.en: Exactly.
And another thing is that I've noticed in some countries you pay rent in advance.
segments.cn: 还有一点是，我注意到在一些国家你是提前支付租金的。

segments.en: Right, so in America you only pay one month's rent at a time, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以在美国你一次只支付一个月的租金，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
So I guess this is an interesting topic.
segments.cn: 所以我想这是个有趣的话题。

segments.en: Real estate and apartment hunting and renting is different in different countries.
segments.cn: 不同国家的房地产和公寓租赁是不同的。

segments.en: So that's where you guys need to come and tell us how does this work in your country.
segments.cn: 所以你们需要来告诉我们在你们国家是怎么运作的。

segments.en: You can also use some of the vocabulary in this dialogue to tell us about your apartment.
segments.cn: 你们也可以使用这个对话中的一些词汇来告诉我们关于你的公寓。

segments.en: Right, how many rooms do you have?
Bedrooms, dining rooms.
What's the square footage?
Exactly.
Or how many square meters, right?
segments.cn: 或者有多少平方米，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
So check out our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以请查看我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Alright, and we'll see you guys there.
Thanks for listening and until next time, goodbye!
segments.cn: 感谢收听，下次再见， goodbye!
